Hi!
I'm currently finishing my PhD at the University of Edinburgh's [Centre for Language Evolution](https://cle.ppls.ed.ac.uk), where I've been supervised by [Prof. Jennifer Culbertson](http://jennifer-culbertson.github.io) and [Prof. Simon Kirby](https://www.simonkirby.net).

[My CV (PDF)](documents/cv_engl.pdf){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button" target="_blank"}


### Research

In my PhD, I used behavioural experiments and computational models to study

- how people segment linguistic material (see [Pankratz et al., 2024](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/cogs.13429)!), 
- how they learn rules from it, 
- how they generalise those rules to novel instances,

and how those processes might shape language.

### Statistics

I'm trained in both Bayesian and frequentist statistics, and I'm very happy to be contacted for stats/methods consulting for your project.

LEL students at Edinburgh can book one-on-one stats chats with me [here](https://outlook.office.com/bookwithme/user/49afe80a7e344adb8ff5770868f0729d@sms.ed.ac.uk?anonymous&ep=plink).
